subject: Physics
question: What is the principle behind the Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle?
option1: Position and momentum cannot be known precisely at the same time
option2: The speed of light is always constant
option3: Energy can be created or destroyed
option4: Objects with mass can travel at the speed of light
correct_answer: Position and momentum cannot be known precisely at the same time
